alert.note: Alert for Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 1:27PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana and northeast Texas, including the following counties and parishes, in northwest Louisiana, Bossier, Caddo, De Soto and Webster. In northeast Texas, Harrison and Panola. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 to in excess of 4 inches of rain have fallen across the Advisory area since early this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of around an inch, with isolated higher amounts, are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Benton, Stonewall, Fosters, Eastwood, Elysian Fields, Deberry, Cross Lake, Forbing, Keithville, Spring Ridge, Bethany, Barksdale Air Force Base, Ferguson and Jonesville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
